headline.main: Parts of New Accords Viewed By Senators as Bases of Treaties; They Hold That Two-Thirds Majority Vote Will Be Needed to Bind This Country -- Favorable Action Is Forecast

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 -- Although Secretary of State Cordell Hull went to Moscow with wide powers as a representative of President Roosevelt, to enter into executive agreements, some of the decisions reached were viewed in Congress today as having provided bases for pacts that would ultimately receive ratification by a two-thirds vote of the Senate.
abstract: Sens views on conf decisions as bases for pacts requiring ratification
